New Records: Norman Powell scored 35 points for the Clippers.
James Harden scored 27 points, including four decisive free throws.
Ivica Zubac had 20 points and 16 rebounds.
CJ McCollum scored 33 points for the Pelicans.
Trey Murphy III and Herbert Jones each scored 18 points.
Dejounte Murray had 13 points, 10 rebounds, 8 assists, and 6 steals.
The Clippers made a season-high 18 three-pointers.
Key Match Events: James Harden made two free throws with 17.9 seconds left to break a tie.
Yves Missi was fouled and missed a free throw, allowing the Clippers to win.
Norman Powell's three-pointer and layup put the Clippers ahead 112-108 with 3:01 remaining.
Herbert Jones made two free throws and CJ McCollum made a layup to tie the score with 2:16 left.
The Pelicans had a 14-0 run in the third quarter giving them a 59-45 lead.
The Clippers responded with three three-pointers to tie the game.
The game was tied twice before Trey Murphy III and others made three-pointers.
Pre-Game Insights: The Los Angeles Clippers were contending while the New Orleans Pelicans were struggling with a 10-game losing streak and 19 losses in 20 games.
Post-Match Reflections: The Clippers secured a win despite the Pelicans' strong performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played on December 31, Manila time.
The Clippers had a three-game winning streak and five wins in their past six games.
